model.parser

Class AbstractDataParser<T extends DataEntry & java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.parser.AbstractDataParser<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Accepts only Type parameters that implements DataEntry and are comparable
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataParser<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCSV, AbstractXML

    public abstract class AbstractDataParser<T extends DataEntry & java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataParser<T>
    AbstractDataParser defines common behaviour for the derived classes
    Since:
    21/7/2019
    See Also:
    AbstractXML, AbstractCSV

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDataParser

        public AbstractDataParser(java.lang.String header,
                          java.lang.String... extensions)
        Swing Filechooser Constructor that opens up the Swing File chooser that accepts files of given header and given extensions only. made for API Flexibility for the lower hierarchy of DataParser
        Parameters:
        header - A header string that represents the Type of Files that can be chosen by file chooser
        extensions - String vararg that represents the extensions of the files that can be chosen given as "TXT" || "txt" (no dot), as the Swing version makes it implicitly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no file was chosen or given invalid inputs

      • AbstractDataParser

        public AbstractDataParser(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                          java.lang.String header,
                          java.lang.String... extensions)
        JavaFX FileChooser constructor that opens up the JavaFx File chooser that accepts files of given header and given extensions only. made for API Flexibility for the lower hierarchy of DataParser
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage of used FX Application
        header - A header string that represents the Type of Files that can be chosen by file chooser
        extensions - String vararg that represents the extensions of the files that can be chosen given as "*.TXT" || "*.txt" (asteric and dot before extension), as the Swing version makes it implicitly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no file was chosen or given invalid inputs

      • AbstractDataParser

        public AbstractDataParser(java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                          java.lang.String... extensions)
        FilePath constructor that uses the given FilePath to construct a File from. after validating to be a valid filepath and the file it holds is of valid extensions using the varargs String extensions and it can be ".txt" or "txt" as endsWith method was used
        Parameters:
        filePath - The Path containing the file path of the file needed
        extensions - A String varargs that has the extensions to validate on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid inputs, if filepath is incorrect or extensions are not applied

      • AbstractDataParser

        public AbstractDataParser(java.io.File file,
                          java.util.regex.Pattern fileValidator)
        File constructor that takes a File that to be converted into an input stream. and takes a compiled regex pattern to match the file name against it for extension validation A pattern is given for API Flexibility for lower level abstract classes
        Parameters:
        file - File to be converted to input stream ( it's name is converted to lower case)
        fileValidator - pattern to be matched against the file extensions (case insensitive as name of file is converted to lower case)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pattern is of incorrect regex or file is null or pattern do not apply on it

      • AbstractDataParser

        public AbstractDataParser(java.net.URL url,
                          java.util.regex.Pattern urlValidator)
        URL constructor that takes a URL that to be converted into an input stream. and takes a compiled regex pattern to match the url against it for extension validation A pattern is given for API Flexibility for lower level abstract classes
        Parameters:
        url - URL to be converted to input stream ( it's name is converted to lower case)
        urlValidator - pattern to be matched against the file extensions (case insensitive as url is converted to lower case)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pattern is of incorrect regex or url is null or pattern do not apply on it

      • getParsedData

        public java.util.List<T> getParsedData()
        Gets the Parsed Data from the input source,
        Specified by:
        getParsedData in interface DataParser<T extends DataEntry & java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
        Returns:
        The parsed Data in an unmodefiable container so can't be added to
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if parse() was not yet used

      • getSource

        public java.io.InputStream getSource()
        Gets the input source of the Data
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface DataParser<T extends DataEntry & java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
        Returns:
        The input source used after converted from file to inputstream or from url to inputStream

      • addPojo

        public boolean addPojo(T pojo)
        Adds a POJO object of same type as the hierarchy.

        A method made for the lower hierarchy levels to have the ability to add elements to the private inherited List of entries that

        and adds it to the list, returning true if accepted, false if not
        Parameters:
        pojo - Pojo object to be added to the list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if null is given as input
